organization.fullName: Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Early Initiation of Butylphthalide Treatment in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke.
identificationModule.officialTitle: Effect of Early Initiation of Butylphthalide on Neural Function in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke -A Prospective, Multicenter, Randomized, Open-label, Blinded End Trial

leadSponsor.name: Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is a prospective, multicenter, randomized, open-label, blinded-endpoint trial designed to evaluate the difference in efficacy of Butylphthalide Sodium Chloride Injection treatment initiated early (\<3 hours) versus late (3-6 hours) in patients with acute ischemic stroke. The aim is to determine the optimal timing window for neuroprotective therapy.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription:
Eligible participants with acute ischemic stroke will be randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to two groups: an early initiation group and a late initiation group.

Early initiation group: Treatment with Butylphthalide Sodium Chloride Injection begins within 3 hours, administered at 100ml per dose, infused twice daily for a continuous period of 10-14 days.

Late initiation group: Treatment with Butylphthalide Sodium Chloride Injection begins between 3-6 hours, also administered at 100ml per dose, infused twice daily for a continuous period of 10-14 days.

armGroups.label: Early initiation group
armGroups.description: Treatment with Butylphthalide Sodium Chloride Injection begins within 3 hours, administered at 100ml per dose, infused twice daily for a continuous period of 10-14 days.

armGroups.label: Treatment with Butylphthalide Sodium Chloride Injection begins within 3 hours, administered at 100ml
armGroups.description: Treatment with Butylphthalide Sodium Chloride Injection begins within 3 hours, administered at 100ml per dose, infused twice daily for a continuous period of 10-14 days.

interventions.name: Butylphthalide treatment initiation time
interventions.description: Eligible participants with acute ischemic stroke will be randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to two groups: an early initiation group (\<3 hours) and a late initiation group (3-6 hours).
armGroupLabels: Treatment with Butylphthalide Sodium Chloride Injection begins within 3 hours, administered at 100ml

primaryOutcomes.measure: The proportion of participants with an mRS score of 0-2

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants with an mRS score of 0-1

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at 6±1 days and 12±2 days compared to baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of participants with an improvement of ≥4 points in NIHSS scores
Proportion of participants with ineffective recanalization
Proportion of participants with recurrent ischemic stroke
Proportion of combined vascular events (recurrent stroke, myocardial infarction, and vascular death)
Difference in cerebral infarction volume size
